values: I look forward to using my blog as a personal journal for my friends and family to read. In college it is difficult to stay in touch and daily talk to my friends who are scattered across the country attending different schools. I enjoy  writing about daily activities inside and outside of school so that I as well as my friends can recall the fun things I have done and learned in school. I am able to look back on all the fun and interesting new things I have done. I will use my blog as a diary so that I have a restricted space where I can express my thoughts to those I am closest to. It is also fun to view other people's blogs and learn about them. By using a blog like livejournal which many students have, I am able to interact and communicate with my friends through reading about their own lives.

I have powershot s200 digital elf and I use it to take pictures all the time. It goes everywhere with me and I am always finding pretty places and funny moments where I use my camera. I normally plug my camera into my tv and let everyone see all the pictures I have taken and sometimes I even make short videos with it. I have downloaded some of my pictures to my computer so that all my friends and family can view them as well.

I learned a lot from Mr. Donald's discussion about bloglines and rss feeds. I learned that bloglines really are an easy way to search for things over the internet. I selected tennis and i found many websites that were helpful and specific enough to meet my request. It was also really simple to save the website and check for updates. Bloglines are unique ways to find news articles through weblogs as well as through RSS. Once your register a username there is easy access to thousands of useful news sites. The site enables its users to have a list of feeds or sites that one frequently visits. Once you are a user you should definitely take advantage of the many extras on the websites such as bookmarks, email subscriptions and much more.

http://www.sillanite.com/index.php

This website has pictures and video of Trinity students climbing mountains all over the United States and participating in other activities such as running, skiing, etc.

Power Point presentations most often are for the use of presenting a group of information to a class. The format common for these presentation is inputting bullet points containing broad topics and themes that guide and organize a group's speaking. It is easier to see colors on a power point that are compatible with one another and it is often better to include a few key images or photos that are visually appealing to the audience.

Through the power point and the websites I found out easier ways to narrow or broaden my searches by using the tools from various search engines along with search directories. With google's more options, I can input keywords I need for my search and omit certain words I do not need as part of my search. Also I learned that the campus library has a variety of search engines that can help me find information for my classes which is helpful because it is a more efficient and accurate engines to use rather than a very broad engines like google or yahoo. I also learned how to put my search into different languages, placing parentheses around certain words, minus signs, etc. in order to make my search more specific.

url: securityresponse.symantec.com

This website lists the latest viruses. Some of these include: W32.Mydoom.AU@mm, PWSteal.Bankash.A, Trojan.Hexem. and others. Along with virus threats the website also lists security programs which can safeguard one's computer. Some of these advisories are Microsoft Office XP HTML Link Processing Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, Microsoft Windows DHCP Server Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability, and others. This website is a group which offers a broad range of software and other programs to secure computers and many security solutions like firewalls, anti-spam solutions, and more. 
One worm called W32.Mydoom.AU@mm sends mass mailings through the use of its own engine and to email addresses found on computers. It affects systems like Windows XP and other windows programs. To fix the worm some suggestions are Symantec Security Response, Live Update, and other online systems.

I learned from yesterday's class that once something is written in a tangible form it is automatically considered copyrighted. Also I learned that it is difficult to prove that someone stole one's work because it is one person's word against another person's word. Also I learned that participation in music, movie, or game file-sharing does not count as a form of plagiarism because that person has not stated that it is his/her work but he/she are simply borrowing that work. Overall I got a better understanding about author's rights and the responsible use of one's work.

I have a dell 8600. I have Microsoft Antivirus and Symantic Antivirus. I am constantly updating both of these programs to ensure that I do not get any viruses, Trojan horses, etc. on my computer. My computer is normally pretty fast but recently it has not been opening programs as quickly. I am thinking about deleting documents I do not need and stop downloading programs that take up a lot of memory on my computer.

Some of my interests include hanging out with friends, reading, watching funny movies, tanning at the beach, text messaging, talking on my cell phone, and site seeing. I am from Los Angeles, California and I am a first year. At trinity, I have participated in some TUVAC activities and I have been rushing also. I am currently undecided for my major but I am leaning toward business. I took a computer course my sophomore year in high school. I am experienced in most Microsoft programs and the Internet.

I am a first year and I live in Winn 127. I am from Los Angeles, California. I went to an all girls Catholic high school right by UCLA. I have two younger sisters, one who is 13 and one who is 16. I used to run cross country and track and field. I enjoy playing golf and tennis too. I am considering rushing at Trinity but I am not sure which sorority I want to be a part of. My interests include going to the beach, tanning at hotel pools with my friends, reading, watching funny movies, and talking on my cell phone.
